reviews.text: With a few minor tweaks, this would more appropriately merit the four star rating that it currently gets on a number of websites. We made our reservation on Priceline so got an excellent prices especailly for the holiday season.
reviews.title: A Very Average Hotel in a Very Great Location

reviews.text: We have stayed at several of the other "four star" properties and the Millenium currently is not even close in terms of quality and service. It is a good place for people who are very familiar with New York City and don't need a lot of assistance from the hotel - if you just need to lay your head down it is fine.
reviews.title: Great location if you want to be in Times Square or Theatre District

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Perfect Location!

reviews.text: - Location, location, location.
reviews.title: Search Elsewhere - Unless You Really Need to Stay Here

reviews.text: - Bar and restaurant and little store in the lobby.
reviews.title: Perfect location and adequate for this trip

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel March 16- March 19. This is my second stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: Safe, Clean & GREAT Location

likes.disliked: — Beds could have used another blanket.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location, Location, Location! This place has it in spades. You could even see part of time square from our room on the 48th floor. It is so close and in such a great spot it is easy to pop in during the day and get right back out to activities. Also, there is a drug store less than a block away, and a deli across the street for quick eats, or bottles of water and soda.
reviews.title: OK for us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check In: Although I see someone stayed there the exact same time as I did, we didn't have any trouble. I had made the booking in my name, but my friend who was staying with me, was going to be there hours before me. I had put her name on the reservation, and she had no trouble what so ever checking us in. When I arrived (many hours later due to the snow storm blanketing the northeast that night) I was able to get my key and head up to the room.
reviews.title: Poor Service, Good Location, Clean Room, Uncomrfotable Bedding
Great Hotel; no complaints
reviews.text: The Room: The room was nice. A bit more posh that the last time. I believe the difference between a regular room on my last visit and this visit was a flat screen tv and designer floor to ceiling headboard for the 2 beds. We were on the 48th floor, and you could see part of times square ( The Hard Rock Cafe & Bubba Gump restaurant) as well as the river! The beds were quite comfortable. The sheets were fine. There are a number of pillows to choose from when sleeping. The bed does come made just with a sheet and coverlet, but there was another actual blanket in the closet I used. The room had a leather lounge chair which was nice. The rooms are very quiet, the only noise we heard much of was some wind rushing around the building. The curtains are blackout curtains, so it can be completely dark, or you can have the times square lights flashing you to sleep if you like.

The bathrooms are large, with the rounded shower bar to allow more room in the shower. The shower did drain slow and the toilet seemed to not like to flush. Although not backing up really, although we didn't complain, so clearly it wasn't that bad.
reviews.title: There are so many choices in NY, pass on this one if you expect the best.

reviews.text: Stayed a weekend at the Millenium Broadway and it was fantastic. Was sceptical of a hotel near Times Square but it was classy and nice. My room had good views of Times Square, the staff were courteous and the location was hard to beat for the action of NY.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel with a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want a good hotel in the centre of the action, this is it. If you want some peace and quiet, look elsewhere.
reviews.title: Thumbs Up For the Millenium_ Great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at various Manhattan hotels over the years. Primarily 4 and 5 star hotels. I must say that I was pleasantly surprised with the experience I had at the Millenium Hotel. The room was a very nice size for NYC. Excellent Location. In the heart of New York, Times Square, Bryant park. You cannot go wrong with the location. Starbucks in right next door. The main train stop to take you anywhere in Manhattan is at Times Square. 1 Block from the hotel.
reviews.title: Don't bother

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was in good shape. Comfortable beds, and the maid service was good. I called down to housekeeping, and asked for a comforter, and was brought one within 3 minutes. It came wrapped up in a dry cleaning bag. Nice and pressed. I was impressed with the speed and service. Front desk was very nice and pleasant. I used the To be honest, the few people who wrote bad reviews must have been at a different hotel, because I could not find any fault with this hotel. I paid 199 for Sunday night, and 249 mid week. Well worth the money! I would stay here again without hesitation at these prices.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are many great places to stay in NYC and this is not one of them.
reviews.title: rotten, rotten over-priced and dirty hotel....avoid

reviews.text: I stayed at the Millennium Broadway for 3 nights in March 07. The hotel has a fantastic location just off Times Square and the connections to the rest of the city are good.
reviews.title: Just OK but great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff was friendly and always joking but the decor was a let down. They have been refurbishing the rooms for some time and I was unlucky enough to get one of the older rooms. The furniture (desperately) needs updating, the carpet is old and even our toiled didn't flush properly.
reviews.title: Great Extended Week-end Break

likes.disliked: — The addition of a standard tip of 18%

reviews.text: All in all OK but nothing great.
reviews.title: A Holiday Inn with a great looking lobby

reviews.text: We have returned from a five day break in this hotel which is sited just off ( 75 metres) Times Square on 44st in New York. We found the reception excellent and efficient. The hotel was as expected clean and safe. Security was evident late at night.
reviews.title: Great place in a great location
Just okay
reviews.text: Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used to stay at this hotel regularly when it was new and known as the Macklowe. It has been under the Millennium umbrella for some years now and the quality has noticeably slipped. There is still a nice art-deco lobby with an air of seeming luxury but that disappears quickly when you ascend to the rooms. At check-in, we requested an upgrade to a corner room and were told that, if we waited until later in the afternoon, that could be arranged. In fact, it was not, although we were assigned one of the larger rooms (3601). The room had lost any sense of style that it had when the hotel was new. It was minimally (but haphazardly) decorated. The platform bed remained, but the quality of the linens had diminished to the level of a Motel 6. The sheets were no longer pressed and the foam pillows were flat as pancakes and hard as rocks. When we requested feather pillows, we were told that the hotel no longer carried them since "most of the guests were allergic" to them. The glass shower doors in the bathroom had been removed and replaced by standard-issue curtains. When we requested a late checkout, we were informed that we would be allotted an extra 30 minutes until 12:30, but that an hourly charge would apply after that. This indicated to me that the room was not, in fact, needed, but late checkout was viewed as a revenue enhancement mechanism for the hotel. We have been regular guests at the Millennium UN Plaza, which recently renovated one of its two towers. We have not stayed there since the renovation, but it was apparent to us that, even before the renovation, that hotel was vastly superior to its sister "Broadway" hotel (e.g. feather pillows, pressed sheets, friendly upgrades, and late checkouts). We will not make the mistake of staying at the Millennium Broadway again.
reviews.title: Bye, Bye Broadway

reviews.text: The Good: location; bath products; superb front desk service; lovely theater;windows that open
reviews.title: Mediocre Millennium

reviews.text: The Bad: lack of a real lobby; small rooms; worn bathroom;
reviews.title: Very Pleased

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Ugly: bed sheets that seemed shorted; the price
reviews.title: Disappointed with poor room standards

reviews.text: I was expecting luxury, but this hotel is more like an upscale Ramada.
reviews.title: What you would expect in a Times Square business hotel. Nothing great, but perfectly ok.

reviews.text: Arrived Dec 14 for 2 nights. My first room, on the 31st floor, was just plain awful. Small, dirty, loud, no comforter, peeling wallpaper, and moldy shower. When I saw the dirty towels and underwear in the bathroom from the previous occupant I called for another room. The front desk quickly upgraded me to a larger room on the 46th floor. What a difference. This room was big, comfortable, clean, a huge down comforter, an updated bathroom, and quiet. So...make sure you ask for an upgrade, or pay for an upgraded room, it makes all the difference.
reviews.title: Depends upon the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed there Dec 13-15, 2012
reviews.title: The smell of feces permeated the room

reviews.text: - location was fantastic
reviews.title: Not what expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - bell staff were friendly and excellent
reviews.title: A wonderful stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - everything else was terrible...
reviews.title: Superb Location!
Quiet and comfortable
reviews.text: It is so rare that a hotel room, even the most expensive one, is actually quiet, but my room at the Millenium was blissfully quiet. No sounds of elevators, slamming doors, the tv next door -- nothing. On the 26th floor, behind double-glass windows, even the sounds of Times Square traffic were almost inaudible.
The beds were firm, but I love that so I slept beautifully. And the staff was friendly and immensely helpful. I loved this place.
reviews.title: Very very nice

likes.liked: — Location and overall a very nice place to stay
likes.disliked: — Food was expensive and room rate was high , but, it is NYC

reviews.text: By the way, the Airlink Shuttle serves this hotel, and it's a great bargain.
reviews.title: We Enjoyed a Great Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We drove to NY ,.no problem getting to the hotel and parking is a breeze. They take your car and the parking is included in the room . We were early and the room was not ready, no problem they take your bags and store them untill your ready to check in.
reviews.title: Great Choice!

likes.disliked: — Would have liked fridge in room.

reviews.text: Check in was no problem, quick and efficent. The rooms were very nice and clean and we had a great view of the Empire State Bld.They have a very nice bar/ lounge off the lobby, Good drinks. We ate breakfast in the hotel, very pricey for breakfast.
reviews.title: My Favorite Place to stay in NYC

likes.disliked: — Parking is a bit outrageous but where isn't it in Manhattan?

reviews.text: April school break - cruise on NCL Dawn. Amtrak from PVD to Penn Station, quick taxi ride to hotel. (Pope was actually in town that weekend - very crowded but still enjoyable to be in the city :-)
reviews.title: Pre-cruise stay - excellent choice

likes.disliked: — If you have a car, parking would be a problem

reviews.text: Stayed one night pre-cruise at Millenium Broadway Hotel near Times Square with my SO and one of my children, age 12 (other one in college so could not join us). Excellent location, great price $284 total via Travelzoo deal. Front desk service (I believe his name was Tabur?)was excellent and they checked us in early. Had renovated room on 40th floor. (make sure to ask for this. Heard that not all rooms are done yet). Very comfortable beds. Starbucks, Irish Pub, Toys R Us only a few steps from the hotel - literally. Great Italian food nearby. Duane's a block away for misc items and even beer and wine. (that's a treat for those from Massachusetts. Can you imagine finding beer at CVS - ha)
reviews.title: Great Location

likes.disliked: — ice machines didn't work on our floor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sunday, took taxi to port - I believe it was also around $15-$20 including generous tip.
reviews.title: Great location, remodeled hotel with large rooms for NY, good service

likes.disliked: — no coffee pot in the room...no vent fan in the bathroom....internet charges

reviews.text: Would stay at this hotel again when we visit NYC. It is centrally located and almost HALF the price of Marriott TImes Square, etc without any discounts !!!
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: We have been goingto the US Open for years but never stayed at such a great location. There were great resturants across the street, many shows 1-2 blocks aways plus, and the #7 subway to the Open was only 2 blks away. My friend is handicapped and accessibility is always a problem. The hotel was great and when we had problems with his scooter, provided us with a wheelchair, and up graded us to a suite so we would have more room. Hi floors have fantastic views of Times Sqq. It was especially busy over Labor Day weekend, but thined out later in the week. Dine after the shows for more intimatcy and more service.
reviews.title: Rooms not 4 star

likes.disliked: — Beds were so bad...and the allergies we got from the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good value for money because of its location, Times Square!
reviews.title: Typical city hotel.

reviews.text: Typical of a city hotel.
reviews.title: Don't bother expecting much from this hotel

reviews.text: The staff were very helpful, kind and cheerful.
reviews.title: Gone downhill significantly in last two years

reviews.text: Rooms rather tired and breakfast very expensive.
reviews.title: Don't Expect much
Millennium Hotel Broadway - Family unfriendly
reviews.text: Would stay there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I were married in NYC just over two years ago, and stayed at the Millennium (albeit the Premier tower) for a week of our two in the city, it was great. So much so, when we returned in July, we thought we couldn't go wrong returning. How wrong were we? OK, we weren't in the Premier, but in a Superior King on a high floor, so we thought it would be good. Firstly, the good. It was a large room by NYC standards, and the reception staff were excellent. We asked for a fridge for the room, as we were there for nine nights, and it promptly arrived on the second request.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: However, the bed was really uncomfortable and the pillows virtually pointless (you might as well have had your head on the mattress). The external noise, considering we were on the 31st floor was instrusive, and the A/C very poor.
reviews.title: A Good Review

reviews.text: Now admittedly, we are night animals, so were out until late, and the cleaning people called the first few mornings to ask if we'd like the room cleaned. So, we quickly got out, and allowed them to do their job. However, that soon stopped, and for the last five days our room wasn't dealt with at all, and no question as to whether we wanted it cleaned. That's just wrong! Until, miraculously, the cleaner arrived in our room at 9am on our departure day, asssumingly to ready the room for the next incumbents, despite the fact we had the 'do not disturb sign' on the door (we had a 24 hour journey home ahead.)
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: Unfortunately, we had recommended the hotel to friends who were on honeymoon this year. They had a great time in Vegas and loved NYC, but really didn't like the Millennium.
reviews.title: Great location, average hotel

likes.disliked: — decor of lobby, dark and gloomy , and orange colors used in rooms

reviews.title: Motel masquerading as "4-star" hotel...
reviews.text: I'm sad to write such a negative review, given our previous experience, but its what we encountered.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 5 nights and thought I would never walk again after sleeping on a sheet of plywood that they called beds..Booked hotel 3 months ahead for a king bed and received 2 double beds ..Booked and paid for a package "City view and breakfast for 2"..Well the view was an office building across the street ...The breakfast couples read "American Breakfast" which on their menu is a sit down breafast with toast and eggs anyway you want them..Was told we could only have the buffet continental breakfast ..Ok that was acceptable as I am not hard to get along with ..The first 4 mornings the restaurant hostess (different ones every morning) were very nice as my wife was not feeling 100% so I asked if I could take our breakfast to go and have in our room..They gave ne to go containers and bags for each breakfast..The 5th morning I was told by the host that they don't allow that..I calmly explained how the previous 4 mornings has worked ...He again said it was not possible and called the restarant manager and she told me the same thing ..She also told me me that she was there the previous mornings ad I had not been there ..She outright called me a liar !!! I left without our breakfasts and went to me room and called the hotel manager..She said I was lucky the first 4 mornings to have it allowed..Said she would get back to us but am still waiting ....Pretty poor customer service for a $350 plus a night hotel..Will not be staying there again!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Location Great But Hotel Care Less About Their Guests

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Great location, lacks atmosphere

reviews.text: Just stayed here for 6 nights, and the hotel is even closer to Times Square than I had expected :) Very good location for newcomers to NYC, but next time I'm not staying this close to Times Square...but that's not the hotels fault :) I would stay at the Millennium again if this was the neighbourhood I wanted to be in.
reviews.title: Absaloutley Fantasic, Value for Money - amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel, we were upgraded to 43rd floor with view of Times Square. Fantastic! Kingsize bed was very comfortable. Bathroom was a bit worn...bathtub was leaking, so the floor was wet after every shower. Housekeeping wasn't very good, and the toilet wasn't cleaned for 2 days...They even woke us up before 9AM on our day of departure to ask when we vere going to check out...
reviews.title: Would stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Did not try the restaurant or the gym. There's a super DELI across the street, and the hotel has an entrance at both 44th and 45th Street.. So, DELI at 44th and Starbucks next door if you went out on 45th. Perfect!
reviews.title: Location, Location

reviews.text: Not a very welcoming hotel, the reception staff were unheplful and not very friendly, the room was ok but nothing special.
reviews.title: Not a very welcoming hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a pleasant stay for the first stop on our honeymoon. The guy at reception put us on the 46th floor in honour of our recent nuptial so that was very nice! Apparently the rooms are much bigger than neighbouring hotels. But we found the overall hotel to be quite void of any character.
reviews.title: Honeymoon on high floor

reviews.text: Location is definitely the highlight of this hotel. Right on Times Square, and a couple blocks from the subway – and you even had several subway lines to choose from.
reviews.title: Rooms not as booked, dirty and poor service. Would never stay again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cleaners were very rude and regularly would try and barge in without bothering to check if anyone was in. Also didn’t do a very good job and most days it looked like hadn’t even bothered to vacuum the place or do a proper clean!
reviews.title: Great location... but nothing more

reviews.text: We got a really good deal, i think we paid around US$250/night which for the location in NYC was really great. But we did book 5 months ahead or something like that.
reviews.title: Great Location, Decent Hotel

reviews.text: Just got back from 4 nights at the Millennium Broadway. The major draw of this hotel is its amazing location, literally a stones throw from Times square right in between the Good Morning America studios & Toys R Us. You could not ask for a better location & as we were on the 43rd floor we never heard any noise from the city that never sleeps. All of the hotel staff were very helpful and welcoming. We stayed in one of the superior rooms which i would def recommend going off other peoples comments about the rooms needing renovating- ours was fine & we had to drag ourselves out of the uber comfy beds every morning. I've stayed in other hotels in New York with bedrooms half the size for similar prices so was very happy with out choice here. I'd def recommend as its such an amazing base to see the best city in the world from- cant wait to go back!
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.text: Stayed here with 2 friends as the location was ideal. Room was smaller than thought,we requested a rollaway bed when we booked, but this was not given. While there we requested a kettle 3 different times (didnt get one) requested an extra pillow (didnt get that) and requested an extra glass (didnt get that either).The location just about saved the trip. Customer service was poor except for the concierge who were very helpful. Bar staff really nice,friendly and helpful. Sergul was lovely checking us out and apologised for other peoples failings. Would stay here again if other hotels not available but wouldnt be rushing back though.
reviews.title: Girls NYC Shopping break

reviews.text: We stayed here because we got a good price on priceline. Still expensive for one night but better then most. When we got there we asked if ther was two beds and he gave us an upgrade no charge. Everyone was very nice and attentive as soon as we walked in the door. It was in a great location and we were able to walk everywhere. It is a hotel in NYC and it was pricy no matter what. Unfortunatly this is everywhere. But for what we paid I think we got a great deal. If your looking for a hotel near times square this is perfect.
reviews.title: Great Stay, Great location, Great service

reviews.text: Love the location - just off Times Square and theatre district - but if you book here - ask to be located in the Annex - it is the newer part of the hotel. The main part of the hotel is hit and miss with rooms - some of them are in serious need of renovation.
reviews.title: There are better choices

reviews.text: If you want to be in the middle of Times Square then this is the hotel for you. If you want any amenities and/or "good" service go somewhere else. To be fair the service isn't necessarily bad, it's just non-existent. Came with suitcases and no offer to help me to the room. Conceirge is playing with his Iphone in the morning and can't be bothered to lift his head to even say good morning. The maintenance standards at the hotel are poor and often scream of just not caring. Floor numbers stencils fell off of many elevators and are never replaced, the housekeeper in my room propped the bathroom door that wouldn't stay open with a bin for 7 straight nights rather than having it fixed by maintenance, the room wasn't dusted and obvious, reachable areas were left with a layer of dust on them. There was also a film on areas of the floor that looked cleanable if the maids would have actually tried cleaning them. My room was outside a service lift and the staff coming in an out couldn't be bothered about the noise they made.
reviews.title: Location and nothing else

reviews.text: The Millennium Broadway Hotel, towering 52 floors is centrally located in Times Square, just steps away from many Broadway theaters, tourist attractions, great shopping and dining options.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

likes.disliked: — Not much lighting in guest rooms, waiting for elevators

reviews.text: I stayed in a superior room on the 50th floor which offered superb views of Times Square. The room was quite large, decorated in modern décor, with a king size bed and nice bathroom. The hotel was kept very clean and the staff was very helpful. The lobby was a lot smaller than the lobby at the Marriott Marquis just across the street and was quite dark. The hotel restaurant was very nice but expensive and the room service menu did not offer a lot of options at all.
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Millenium was nice, clean and had decent sized hotel rooms. The two of us had no problem moving around in there. The hotel is about a half-block off Broadway at Times Square. It's a good, but crowded, location. Still, you can walk over to 6th Ave. and get a cab easily.
reviews.title: Fantastic holiday helped by great hotel facilities

likes.disliked: — at times the location - throngs of people to fight through in Time Square especially at night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At night, security demanded to see hotel room keys before letting you get very far into the lobby, which was a nice touch. The hotel also has an ATM on the second floor and a theatre desk in the lobby, so you don't have to go anywhere to get theatre tickets.
reviews.title: Great Hotel except for two small irritations

likes.disliked: — The showerhead and trickle of water that came out of it

reviews.title: Good midtown option
reviews.text: My friend was in town for work and she said the desk and chair in the room was very nice to work at -- comfortable and convenient. She also had no problems getting into her work email account, a problem she has had at other NYC hotels due to fire walls built into the Internet system.

Having found an ad on travelzoo for a room at the Millenium for under $200 in the middle of July we were shocked to see a Times Square hotel of decent quality at this rate. We were overwhelmingly impressed to find that the hotel blew away our expectations. The rooms are recently renovated, clean and spacious (for NYC). The check-in process was quick and efficient and the location is superb. I will absolutely be back to this hotel and was thrilled to find such a gem and certainly such a sweet deal.
reviews.title: What a find!

reviews.text: We stayed here for a business meeting and the rooms were very small like most New York hotels, but we were upgraded to 50th floor after having a smoking room assigned. The upgrade was a full size bed. We called for some extra pillows and blankets twice and was never received. The front desk staff was not very helpful. The room was freezing most of the time. The location is very crowded being right off of Times Square. There is a great place to eat right next door called Bond 45 which was the best meal we had. The homemade pizza was the best. The Concenigere desk was very helpful.
reviews.title: Not the Palace.........

reviews.text: I prefer staying closer to Rockfeller Center.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Great Location

reviews.text: We stayed at the Millennium from July 3 to July 8, 2008.
reviews.title: Good location - but bad hotel experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was a breeze and the room was great.
reviews.title: Definitely Not Worth the Price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like others I also booked a special deal on Travelzoo which included a free upgrade to a superior room. We were given a superior room on the corner on the 45th floor with views of Time Square. Room and bathroom were huge. Bed was comfortable.
reviews.title: Great location and value for New York

likes.disliked: — Wait for lifts during busy periods

reviews.text: Location was central and on doorstep to bustling Times Square. Would definitely consider staying here again.
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.text: The staff was SO GREAT! I travel a lot and have never had a staff be so friendly and helpful. I actually changed my room 3 times and they were great about it. My first room was on the 52 floor (too high for me), then I went to the 16th floor (the electrical outlets didn't work in the bathroom, and then I was in 3311, GREAT room!!!! Fabulous location!!!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel & Great Location
Pretty good
reviews.text: Just returned from a 3 day stay at Millennium Broadway, and I can't complain...The front desk was very helpful at checking in and checking out, they had no problem holding our luggage after we checked out, one thing about this hotel was how friendly the staff was. It was a very clean hotel, our room was very nice, and the beds were very comfortable, and the air condition was always on keeping the room at a relaxing temperature..We were on the 24th floor, and the only noises that we heard were sirens from police, and ambulance. The best part about Millennium is the location, we were right in the middle of times square, so everything was within walking distance, including many of top tourist attractions.. didn't take one cab. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC!
This hotel is well located near Time Square but as a result, it is pricey. Even on Priceline, it came in at over $240 a night.
reviews.title: Thanks to Travelzoo, I enjoyed my 1 night stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff was great. We booked through a secondary provider and were treated very well at check-in. We requested a king bed in smoke-free room and this request was granted. The room was very clean and well maintained. The hotel is located very near Time Square. My only criticism was that we could hear a party on the hotel roof accost the street on Saturday night that went on until 3:00 AM. The Friday and Sunday nights were quiet – so try to get a room on the highest floor possible – especially on weekends. To be fair – I can not blame this hotel for the noise from an adjacent building.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in NYC

likes.liked: — The service at the front desk
likes.disliked: — Noise from adjacent building roof-top party

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is amazing. staff are really friendly and the rooms are awesome. make sure you get a superior room as the views are incredible. we stayed on the 50th floor - room 5004, brilliant view of the empire state and the hard rock cafe.
reviews.title: Best Hotel on Times Square's doorstep

likes.disliked: — mini bar pricing and having to come home :(

reviews.text: air con is awesome and room has everything you will ever need
reviews.title: Great stay, but not 5-star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to stay in the heart of NY, this is a great hotel to consider.
reviews.title: You get what they promise you

reviews.text: Positives:
reviews.title: IGNORE THE NEGATIVE REVIEWS!

likes.disliked: — Had to return because room wasn't ready.

reviews.text: We stayed only one night but it was a very good experience. If you can, choose the deluxe rooms that have been upgraded and something on a higher level. Higher floors tend to be quieter with lots less street noise.
reviews.title: Not bad for Times Square

likes.liked: — Comfy beds and lots of work space.
likes.disliked: — Having to pay for internet service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is within walking distance of many attractions and easy transit. It's especially handy for crashing after a long day of shopping then a Broadway show!
reviews.title: Excellent Location!

reviews.text: We had a room with 2 doubles - very comfortable, fair sized bathroom (though showing some wear and tear) and lots of room for luggage and working.
reviews.title: Millennium a Mixed Bag

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was easy, friendly, and all the staff were pleasant.
reviews.title: Wonderful Millennium- we'll go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I prefer quieter parts of town to Times Square but needed to be there those few days and found the Millenium an excellent choice. If the price is right go for it!
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel in the heart of New York.

likes.liked: — The location, right on Times Square.

reviews.text: Great location in the middle of Times Sq. Rooms and general decor of hotel dated. Never ate at the hotel restaurant as it was not enticing one bit. Service mixed; concierge and check-in did not give the impression of professionalism but doorman had big smile and fast attentive service.
reviews.title: Blah

reviews.text: No proper lobby area is a big no-no. Also, it was raining and they ran out of umbrellas for guests. Very old elevators that although function, did not reassure in terms of security. Overall, a very blah stay and next time in New York, will look elsewhere. Rooms although re-fitted, don't look great. Also, you have pay for wi-fi.
reviews.title: Ideal location for Times Sq and Broadway.

reviews.text: Stayed here for 5 nights for a business and pleasure trip to New York. The rooms are clean and functional though a little dated. Our room was serviced daily but some of the bed linen was worn and torn plus there was no duvet cover provided. Be careful not to remove any beverages from the mini bar as they will be automatically be charged to the room, plus we had extra charges for drinks that we had not consumed. (These were deleted later at checkout). Distinct lack of restaurants within the hotel though there were plenty within the area catering for all tastes and budgets. We used The Red Flame Diner for breakfast which was around half the cost of prices at the hotel restaurant. We also used the Bond 45 bar and grill which is next door plus the irish bars, Connollys and Lunneys, across the street, all of which gave good value and service.
reviews.title: EXCELLENT! Highly recommended!!!

reviews.text: There are no tea making facilities in the rooms, fortunately I'd read previous reviews and bought our own, sadly our kettle was 240V and took ages to boil!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, big rooms for Manhattan

reviews.text: Don't forget your power adaptor if you're visiting from outside US, though they do sell them in the hotel shop.
reviews.title: Perfect Location, Clean Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I went to New York in July and decided to stay at the Millenium because we found a great deal through Travelzoo and we wanted to stay in the Broadway area.
reviews.title: Perfect Place to Stay for Time Square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't think of a more ideal location than Millenium. We had a room on the second to top floor of the hotel. Our room had big windows covering two sides of the corner of the room. From that high up, you can imagine how nice the view was, especially with the lights at night. I thought the room was clean and spacious, which is all you can really ask for. I had no problems with the comfort of the bed or the bathroom. There was wireless internet access for a fee.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk was very helpful with tips on places to go to eat, and the bellhop had no problems taking and watching our bags when we were several hours too early for check-in.
reviews.title: It was better than I expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even though you are in Time Square, you don't hear a peep when you're inside your room. That was nice, especially after a hectic day of walking around. Just a heads up: If you come back to the hotel very late, one entrance to the hotel will be locked and you will have to go all the way to the other side to get in. And make sure to have your room key with you to show the front desk on the way in.
reviews.title: OK if you find a bargain

reviews.text: So I really enjoyed my stay and with the deal I got, it was a great value. The ONLY complaint I have is that being on a high floor, it takes the elevator forever to get to the lobby. But that's nitpicking. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay.
reviews.title: Great Location
